If you suspect that your ear piercing is infected, it is important to take steps to treat it promptly. Here are some steps you can follow: 1. Don't remove the earring: While it may be tempting to remove the earring, you should avoid doing so unless specifically advised by a medical professional. Removing the earring can trap the infection inside, which could make the problem worse. 2. Clean the affected area: Gently clean the infected area with warm water and a mild soap. You can also use saline solution to cleanse the wound. Avoid using alcohol or hydrogen peroxide, as these can be too harsh and could delay the healing process. 3. Apply a warm, moist compress: Soak a clean cloth or cotton ball in warm water and apply it to the infected area. This can help to reduce swelling and inflammation, and may also help to release any pus that has built up. 4. Take over-the-counter pain relievers: If you are experiencing pain or discomfort, you can take an over-the-counter pain reliever like acetaminophen or ibuprofen. Be sure to follow the dosage instructions carefully, and don't exceed the recommended dose. 5. See a doctor if symptoms persist: If your symptoms don't improve within a few days, or if they get worse, you should see a doctor. They may prescribe antibiotics to help clear up the infection, or recommend other treatments depending on the severity of the infection.

It's also a good idea to ask if there will be other desserts or snacks served, which could affect the amount of cake needed. Remember, it's always better to have too much cake than not enough, so when in doubt, err on the side of caution and order or make a larger cake.
